messages:
[{'account_id': 27741, 'date': '2018-08-20 07:54:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-08-20 07:54:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 14806, 'date': '2018-08-20 11:31:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27741, 'date': '2018-08-20 13:40:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-08-20 15:13:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27741, 'date': '2018-08-20 16:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
iSCSI: Clean up source VIOS on migration

Whenever a VM migrated from one host to another
the source VIOS had hdisk remaining after LPM.
The current change makes sure that VIOS hdisks
get cleaned up after migration.

Change-Id: I3c085a872abbaf6e6e91b2496314a06ce8e7ba58

commit_message:
Adding Trinh Nguyen candidacy for Searchlight PTL

Since no one commits to managing the project and it has been missing
several milestones, It may be removed from governance. I volunteer
to take over maintenance of the project in Stein cycle hopefully to
bring it back to active state.

Self introduction:

- Though not having any experience directly related
to SearchLight, I have several years working on ELK stack and log
analysis. My current research also leverages logs management for
fault management.

- Currently, I'm an SDN/NFV researcher at Soongsil University
, and an active Tacker team member.

Depends-On: I632b203af1e7a7fca5124bed735b38d61b43b7ab
Change-Id: I6aee3675f4b37f4912bb41727e41ee5e3898d503

The searchlight team missed several milestones and so will not be
included in the Rocky release [1]. They also missed the PTL elections
[2], and the current PTL can no longer commit to managing the

that the team is no longer active.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
remove searchlight from governance

The searchlight team missed several milestones and so will not be
included in the Rocky release [1]. They also missed the PTL elections
[2], and the current PTL can no longer commit to managing the
project. This patch removes the project from governance to indicate
that the team is no longer active.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-August/132866.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-August/132690.html

Change-Id: Ic3e0d3b0438113c0dd8963d9940a4c2b445e0305
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove the last remnants of get-pip.py

We no longer use get-pip.py for anything, so remove the checks
for it, the docs and all other mentions.

Change-Id: Ied16ea1bb1516f133c3db88783c1cf969f469bf5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-16 16:08:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix DIB_REPOREF_amphora_agent not set on Git !=1.8.5

Setting DIB_REPOREF_amphora_agent with git -c does not work. The option
-c is for passing key-value configurations and git -C option was
introduced in git v1.8.5 which some distros do not include (e.g. CentOS
7.5 ships with git v1.8.3.1). As a result, DIB_REPOREF_amphora_agent is
not set on any git version !=1.8.5.

The alternative that works across all tested Git versions is: git
--git-dir=/.git sub-command

Change-Id: I41993fa0f8bfde4b7ca9509872de5b54e2ed5680
Story: 2003067
Task: 23114
(cherry picked from commit 88649d95477f63100ae64ee174347da8a7ddd903)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix DIB_REPOREF_amphora_agent not set on Git !=1.8.5

Setting DIB_REPOREF_amphora_agent with git -c does not work. The option
-c is for passing key-value configurations and git -C option was
introduced in git v1.8.5 which some distros do not include (e.g. CentOS
7.5 ships with git v1.8.3.1). As a result, DIB_REPOREF_amphora_agent is
not set on any git version !=1.8.5.

The alternative that works across all tested Git versions is: git
--git-dir=/.git sub-command

Change-Id: I41993fa0f8bfde4b7ca9509872de5b54e2ed5680
Story: 2003067
Task: 23114

commit_message:
Fix API extensions names

Apparently some of the API extensions had their name changed along the
way and networking-ovn didn't catch up with the new names.

This patch is updating the extensions.py module so it uses the new names
for the extensions.

Change-Id: Id784303f2c1e89284db807d4a6cdb4816fade3aa

commit_message:
[WIP] import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I4c6978c28d4dd1e6b16e1de06d87e0ff52616db7
Story: #2003267

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-13 15:08:55.000000000', 'message': "Install eatmydata inside containers

The eatmydata cli tool and library can be used to convert fsync()
into a no-op either at the cli via the 'eatmydata' command, or
by adding libeatmydata.so to the LD_PRELOAD environment variable.

The patch makes eatmydata available for use, but makes no use of it.

Change-Id: Ic9e82fa455219234464a106e9b48469cb0aef2ff
"}]
commit_message:
Install eatmydata inside containers

The eatmydata cli tool and library can be used to convert fsync()
into a no-op either at the cli via the 'eatmydata' command, or
by adding libeatmydata.so to the LD_PRELOAD environment variable.

The patch makes eatmydata available for use, but makes no use of it.

Change-Id: Ic9e82fa455219234464a106e9b48469cb0aef2ff

commit_message:
Implements: code-changes/port-mirroring-sriov-vf:

Port TaaS APIs to OpenStack CLI  - taas client code into neutron code

Add support for Tap as a Service resources (Tap Service and Tap Flow) for:-
1. Creation
2. Updation
3. Deletion

Change-Id: I169e13b3ca54336ff11f06f0b1ae8cd533b80b8b

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I81fb2e1318c7e4894b759f5bf462c71f0a6d8e69
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-16 10:19:28.000000000', 'message': 'Instance create fails due to wrong default secontext with NFS

With NovaNfsEnabled instance create fails due to wrong default
secontext. The default in THT is set to nova_var_lib_t in
Ie4fe217bd119b638f42c682d21572547f02f17b2 while
system_u:object_r:nfs_t:s0 should have access. The virt_use_nfs
boolean, which is turned on by openstack-selinux, should cover
this use case.

This changes the default to context=system_u:object_r:nova_t:s0

Change-Id: I2a28462b6f6bc9f8a41a81ea8c65471f05df3b85
Closes-Bug: 1781894
'}, {'created': '2018-07-20 12:02:22.000000000', 'message': 'Instance create fails due to wrong default secontext with NFS

With NovaNfsEnabled instance create fails due to wrong default
secontext. The default in THT is set to nova_var_lib_t in
Ie4fe217bd119b638f42c682d21572547f02f17b2 while
system_u:object_r:nfs_t:s0 should have access. The virt_use_nfs
boolean, which is turned on by openstack-selinux, should cover
this use case.

This changes the default to context=system_u:object_r:nova_t:s0

commit_message:
Instance create fails due to wrong default secontext with NFS

With NovaNfsEnabled instance create fails due to wrong default
secontext. The default in THT is set to nova_var_lib_t in
Ie4fe217bd119b638f42c682d21572547f02f17b2 while
system_u:object_r:nfs_t:s0 should have access. The virt_use_nfs
boolean, which is turned on by openstack-selinux, should cover
this use case.

This changes the default to context=system_u:object_r:nfs_t:s0

Change-Id: I2a28462b6f6bc9f8a41a81ea8c65471f05df3b85
Closes-Bug: 1781894

commit_message:
Reliably build the subnode_ip_pair

Since the change I9617dafff83f800ed75b4478c7040301b0c944a1 there is
now 2 private network interfaces, so using the networks list to return
subnode_ip_pair now returns 3 entries, which breaks the reproducer.

This change returns the IP addresses from the floating IP, so that any
changes to the subnode networking won't cause issues here again.

Change-Id: I3f20e34e03874cfbd4701c70f9818141568b4d55

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-09 16:41:50.000000000', 'message': 'AIO - Improve robustness of network configuration.

The systemd_network role currently starts the network service and then
restarts it in a handler. This means that the newly configured network
devices are torn down and rebuilt for no benefit, and this does not
seem to be reliable on Ubuntu Bionic.

This change moves the point at which the network service is started out
of the systemd_network role to a point where all of the various network
configuration files and services have been created. This means that
the network service should start once, cleanly, with all of the config
already present.

In addition, this patch adds verification that the network bridges are
working, there is little point continuing execution if the network setup
is defective.

Change-Id: I6d581670eba98bc2f0f2e676bb1f59dce16f7f42

Change-Id: I6d581670eba98bc2f0f2e676bb1f59dce16f7f42
'}, {'created': '2018-08-20 09:09:41.000000000', 'message': 'AIO - Improve robustness of network configuration.

Change-Id: I6d581670eba98bc2f0f2e676bb1f59dce16f7f42
'}]
commit_message:
AIO - Improve robustness of network configuration.

The systemd_network role currently starts the network service and then
restarts it in a handler. This means that the newly configured network
devices are torn down and rebuilt for no benefit, and this does not
seem to be reliable on Ubuntu Bionic.

This change moves the point at which the network service is started out
of the systemd_network role to a point where all of the various network
configuration files and services have been created. This means that
the network service should start once, cleanly, with all of the config
already present.

In addition, the network post-up service is refactored so that each
interface with post-up actions has a specific one-shot service
dedicated to that interface. These actions should be triggered individually
when each interface becomes active.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/593358
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/593546
Change-Id: I6d581670eba98bc2f0f2e676bb1f59dce16f7f42

commit_message:
Make sure ovs bridge is created before setting mac-table-size

After [1] puppet-ovn is setting mac-table-size using ovs-vsctl which
requires the bridge to exist in advance or it will fail.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580114/

Change-Id: Ic54ec0bd81817982559e80bef1f152063073e5e5

commit_message:
Add support to validate a subset of binding:profile dictionary parameters

The following patch shall allow to validate a subset of input parameters
provided as part of port's binding:profile dictionary. At present it adds
validation of [vf_vlan_filter, vf_public_vlans, vf_private_vlans,
vf_guest_vlans, vf_vlan_mirror, vf_pci_slot, pf_pci_slot, pf_pci_vendor_info
parameters used by tap-as-a-service sriov driver

Change-Id: I1db9840725b3cd8367eb571213496ca5d687c226

commit_message:
Add support to validate a subset of binding:profile dictionary parameters

The following patch shall allow to validate a subset of input parameters
provided as part of port's binding:profile dictionary. At present it adds
validation of [vf_vlan_filter, vf_public_vlans, vf_private_vlans,
vf_guest_vlans, vf_vlan_mirror, vf_pci_slot, pf_pci_slot, pf_pci_vendor_info
parameters used by tap-as-a-service sriov driver

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/591506
Change-Id: I0de87d0a03204e4eae0af731ceeacae14b97ccfc

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-17 14:12:35.000000000', 'message': "Switch test runner to django default runner

nose is not actively maintained now and Django default test runner
seems to have enough features.

* Horizon test setting no longer depends on nose and related stuffs.
  This commit cleans up nose related dependencies.
  The change was made in horizon Rocky-3,
  so horizon 14.0.0.0b3 is required at least.
* Integraion tests is marked via django.test.tag mechanism which is
  introduced in Django 1.10.
* Rename filename of test files to names starting with 'test_'
  so that the django test runner can find tests expectedly.
* run_tests.sh is no longer called from tox.ini, so it can be dropped.
  Note that the similar run_tests.sh in horizon was dropped long ago.

Change-Id: I1e5471078cc95031e8819f01100319a9ee2a3a73

commit_message:
Switch test runner to django default runner

nose is not actively maintained now and Django default test runner
seems to have enough features.

* Horizon test setting no longer depends on nose and related stuffs.
  This commit cleans up nose related dependencies.
  The change was made in horizon Rocky-3,
  so horizon 14.0.0.0b3 is required at least.
* Integraion tests is marked via django.test.tag mechanism which is
  introduced in Django 1.10.
* Rename filename of test files to names starting with 'test_'
  so that the django test runner can find tests expectedly.
* run_tests.sh is no longer called from tox.ini, so it can be dropped.
  Note that the similar run_tests.sh in horizon was dropped long ago.

Change-Id: I1e5471078cc95031e8819f01100319a9ee2a3a73

I have tested this version on my SAIO and it indeed works, using legacy key_id, then defining new keys. Accessing the old data. If I remove a key from the config (Which I shouldn't do), i can't access those objects encrypted using that key.

So nice work."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-08-17 17:58:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-08-21 13:08:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-27 07:05:32.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: multi-key KMIP keymaster

Change-Id: Ie52508e47d15ec5c4e96902d3c9f5f282d275683
'}, {'created': '2018-07-29 20:16:12.000000000', 'message': "Multi-key KMIP keymaster

Now that the trivial keymaster supports multiple keys, let's do
something similar for the KMIP keymaster. Additional keys are
configured as:

    key_id_<secret_id> = <KMIP unique identifier>

While it might be tempting to use the unique identifier directly as the
secret_id, the added indirection allows operators to move keys between
different backends, which may cause different identifiers to be issued.

As with the trivial keymaster, the key to use for PUTs and POSTs is
specified with:

    active_root_secret_id = <secret_id>

Change-Id: Ie52508e47d15ec5c4e96902d3c9f5f282d275683
"}, {'created': '2018-07-30 16:52:18.000000000', 'message': "Multi-key KMIP keymaster

different backends, which may cause different identifiers to be issued.

As with the trivial keymaster, the key to use for PUTs and POSTs is
specified with:

    active_root_secret_id = <secret_id>

Change-Id: Ie52508e47d15ec5c4e96902d3c9f5f282d275683
"}]
commit_message:
Multi-key KMIP keymaster

Now that the trivial keymaster supports multiple keys, let's do
something similar for the KMIP keymaster. Additional keys are
configured as:

    key_id_<secret_id> = <KMIP unique identifier>

While it might be tempting to use the unique identifier directly as the
secret_id, the added indirection allows operators to move keys between
different backends, which may cause different identifiers to be issued.

As with the trivial keymaster, the key to use for PUTs and POSTs is
specified with:

    active_root_secret_id = <secret_id>

Change-Id: Ie52508e47d15ec5c4e96902d3c9f5f282d275683

subject: Modified lower constraints for openstacksdk
messages:
[{'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2018-08-07 09:09:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-08-07 15:35:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

what downstream consumers of openstacksdk would need to update to consume this fix?'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-08-08 01:08:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Matthew,

openstacksdk is widely used by many OpenStack services but we need this fix badly for masakari which is a instance-ha service.

For masakari service, openstacksdk is used in python-masakariclient [1] and masakari-monitors [2].

Note: In masakari-monitors even though openstacksdk is used, it wasn't mentioned in global requirements i.e. requirements.txt in stable/queens branch. This issue has been fixed in the Rocky.

[1] : https://github.com/openstack/python-masakariclient/blob/stable/queens/requirements.txt#L5

[2] : https://github.com/openstack/masakari-monitors/blob/stable/queens/masakarimonitors/ha/masakari.py#L16"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-08-08 02:56:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'll bring it up during the meeting tomorrow, I don't think queens has per-project requirements, so this may mean you'd have to sync out the new minimum manually.  It seems there are ~20 or so projects using openstacksdk that'd need to be updated."}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-08-08 03:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Matthew,

I agree with you. If overall we don't get consensus to merge this patch, then we will update minimum requirements in python-masakariclient and masakari-monitors projects. Also we need to see if we can make "requirements-check" gate job non-voting otherwise patches proposed to these projects will not be merged after approval.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-08-08 20:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

is there a reason why updating constraints is not good enough?'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-08-09 01:50:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Matthew,

Unfortunately python-masakariclient is not using osc_lib and all sdk code  was part of python-masakariclient [2] itself in stable/queens. python-masakariclient and masakari-monitors are completely broken in stable/queens due to proxy related changes done in openstacksdk [3] in Queens release. These changes done in SDK weren't addressed properly in python-masakariclient and masakari-monitors. Now, we are fixing this issue in stable/queens in patch [1].

Patch [1] fixes this issue in python-masakariclient for sdk version >=0.11.0 but in 0.9.19 and 0.10.0 sdk versions, it's failing to create connection object as explained in the commit message.

[1] : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/588157
[2] : https://github.com/openstack/python-masakariclient/tree/stable/queens/masakariclient/sdk
[3] : https://github.com/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/f9b96861577e26f0540158e00706e2505213f4bf#diff-0fbc1bc8e7b00464f7eb4049a015479a"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-08-09 02:59:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So is gate currently working in queens?  I ask this because currently openstacksdk is targeting 0.11.3 in queens.
Global requirements has a lower minimum, but that should be the one in use.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-08-10 01:16:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

With patch [1], python-masakariclient will work with sdk versions >=0.11.0.

If user tries to run masakari with sdk versions 0.9.19 or 0.10.0 as supported by stable/queens, then it won't work. Hence we are trying to update minimum lower version of sdk to 0.11.0.

But as you have pointed out it's going to affect 20 other projects, so we will update requirements.txt of python-masakariclient to use >=0.11.0 and make requirements-check gate job non-voting only in case of stable/queens branch.

[1] : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/588157"}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2018-08-21 15:07:31.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Marking this as Abandon, since as per last comment by Tushar Patil, updating requirements.txt of python-masakariclient to use >=0.11.0 and make requirements-check gate job non-voting only in case of stable/queens branch as per [1]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/588157'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-07 09:09:26.000000000', 'message': "Modified lower constraints for openstacksdk

Updated openstacksdk lower constraints from 0.9.19 to 0.11.0
because python-masakariclient and masakari-monitors fails to
create connection as service descriptors are not supported in
these versions and profile parameter doesn't work at all.

This is a blocker issue [1] in masakariclient and
masakari-monitors for stable/queens branch. A patch is proposed
to fix this issue [2] and it works with openstacksdk
versions >= 0.11.0.

[1]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/masakari/+bug/1779752
[2]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/588157

Change-Id: I24ec493f3333a5b3f6bfed9395c921fb28500065
"}]
commit_message:
Modified lower constraints for openstacksdk

Updated openstacksdk lower constraints from 0.9.19 to 0.11.0
because python-masakariclient and masakari-monitors fails to
create connection as service descriptors are not supported in
these versions and profile parameter doesn't work at all.

This is a blocker issue [1] in masakariclient and
masakari-monitors for stable/queens branch. A patch is proposed
to fix this issue [2] and it works with openstacksdk
versions >= 0.11.0.

[1]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/masakari/+bug/1779752
[2]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/588157

Change-Id: I24ec493f3333a5b3f6bfed9395c921fb28500065

commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: Ib240b8c16dce80910d952e9eec860669af1ec399
(cherry picked from commit 47031b6087b25e6cb346563d8280fdbe7ff36c99)

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Id7c36e975203056224d104f6926647b0e65abafb
Story: #2002586
Task: #24332

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Ibb97ddc7dc3a1c1cd7b4734377188fa625ddef7e
(cherry picked from commit 79d872a99a7b4eb5697b126c2549b8750442024f)

commit_message:
Rename #openstack-101 to #openstack-dev

Freenode IRC channel #openstack-101 is retired and upstream
institute participants are encouraged to join #openstack-dev
channel.

Note: This patch aligns with
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561082/

Change-Id: Ifdca409b4dfa1744c4d688647a639e757a250b8e

commit_message:
add required deployed server config for pike

This adds the required deployed server environment config
for using deployed server w/ pike where --deployed-server
options are not yet available.

Closes-Bug: #1785067
Change-Id: I023d431ac9d4cc97baa7ed8f7da75f1f114c735c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-20 07:58:56.000000000', 'message': 'Set bgp_router_id to a fixed ip

Review [1] added support for bgp-dragent. By default btp_router_id is
set to fact ipaddress. This fact can change between different puppet
runs as new network interfaces can be added, for exmple bg-ex, breaking
idempotency.

This patch sets bgp_router_id to 127.0.0.1 as it can be any ipv4
address.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/583222

Change-Id: I67e8085b4f4d507c4d3040a7ee4b5e1b928afdb4
'}, {'created': '2018-08-21 06:32:13.000000000', 'message': 'Set bgp_router_id to a fixed ip

Review [1] added support for bgp-dragent. By default btp_router_id is
set to fact ipaddress. This fact can change between different puppet
runs as new network interfaces can be added, for exmple bg-ex, breaking
idempotency.

This patch sets bgp_router_id to 127.0.0.1 as it can be any ipv4
address.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/583222

Change-Id: I67e8085b4f4d507c4d3040a7ee4b5e1b928afdb4
'}]
commit_message:
Set bgp_router_id to a fixed ip

Review [1] added support for bgp-dragent. By default btp_router_id is
set to fact ipaddress. This fact can change between different puppet
runs as new network interfaces can be added, for exmple bg-ex, breaking
idempotency.

This patch sets bgp_router_id to 127.0.0.1 as it can be any ipv4
address.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/583222

Change-Id: I67e8085b4f4d507c4d3040a7ee4b5e1b928afdb4

This reverts commit e5dae9b35349c53fa6184e415e254094893cab1f
(and commit 1ca8555011ad345e6343eded2fcca4516aa70944 which is

commit_message:
Revert "Network Topology graph "twitches""

This reverts commit e5dae9b35349c53fa6184e415e254094893cab1f
(and commit 1ca8555011ad345e6343eded2fcca4516aa70944 which is
a follow-up styling fix).

The reverted commit itself is a nice improvement,
but considering the situation that Rocky release is approaching
at the end of August we revert this to recover the original
user-visible behavior. It would be nice if someone can revisit
the improvement in the next Stein release.

Change-Id: If324bd47a1b8c1b9579c1f38adeae31fdf583780
Closes-Bug: #1786628
Related-Bug: #1716834
(cherry picked from commit 9fbdc81038d13864c9280102c6a357e29f259ac5)

commit_message:
Stop relying on VCPU count in the introspection tests

Starting with Rocky bare metal nodes no longer expose VCPU/DISK/RAM,
just use hypervisor count instead.

Change-Id: I792d1e04dc9d98341f9ee8106507afd43c980187

Zuul is not reading tox.ini for docs gates now.

commit_message:
Fix doc requirements

Zuul is not reading tox.ini for docs gates now.
https://github.com/openstack-infra/zuul-jobs/blob/master/ \
roles/install-if-python/tasks/main.yaml#L1-L2

Make doc requirements explicit to please it.

Change-Id: Ied6af3d4aa09cd0f38a53bce98349dc77c13a7a3

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I78513f5436df12bd9aeb08a74afb2f46cde2a5b8
Story: #2002586
Task: #24332

commit_message:
Set initial quota in Quobyte and correct resizing

Ensure a shares initial quota is set in the backend,
and do quota size conversion when resizing.

Closes-Bug: #1771958
Closes-Bug: #1771970

Change-Id: I64a1e591c2682bc8bb62554a95399b5651253f59

commit_message:
Added Handling Newer Quobyte API Error Codes

This added the capability to expect specific error codes when doing a
RPC call in the Quobyte driver. This is used to handle the newer
API error codes in newer (1.4+) Quobyte API versions. This also adds
explicitely creating a Quobyte tenant.

Closes-Bug: #1733807

Change-Id: I65e87e6f50e12bfbe5d7a8fd988ca14bddd212da
(cherry picked from commit 269942101be6de85005969af6b700dbcfdccedd1)

commit_message:
Bump hacking to 1.1.0

hacking 1.0+ adds a couple of additional checks that are helpful as part
of the transition to Python 3. However, hacking 1.1.0 incorporated
flake8 2.6.x, which transitioned from pep8 to pycodestyle. Tempest
provides some hacking extensions and these use pep8 imports. As things
stand, projects that wish to use these hacking extensions must either
constrain themselves to the same older hacking versions or install pep8
manually. Neither of these approaches is particularly attractive so
instead transition to hacking 1.1.0 ourselves. This has the benefit of
giving us the additional checks for Python 3.

Change-Id: I09e3d2461366bb439bcb817149ce807a232acfbb

commit_message:
Add etc/*.conf files to .gitignore

This commit makes etc/*.conf files be ignored from git repo. We don't
need to track user configuration files not only tempest.conf but also
the others such as custom-tempest.conf.

Change-Id: I46b3828426a37291205812bf377e7eeece9b7e0b

commit_message:
Remove checksum checks/fill, they are not needed any longer

We currently run the agents on bare metal so the workaround for
checksums is no longer necessary.

The checksum fill option, was useful a long time ago, but at this point
its just some lovely technical debt that we carry around like an old
dirty security blanket. This change sets us free from the sins of our
past.

This is a combined backport of https://review.openstack.org/593090
and https://review.openstack.org/591882 which were squashed into
https://review.openstack.org/590778.

Change-Id: I9a8cfd33ad43e50584819b84172d7ba84532f695

commit_message:
Only configure rsyslog when present

If rsyslog is not installed, we shouldn't try to configure the swift
rules for it.

Change-Id: Ib110e3c87000241257f35fd4094b9040ff1d697b
Closes-Bug: #1788051

commit_message:
Fix rsyslog restart for swift

The ansible variable to restart rsyslog if it's being configured
referenced a non existant variable.

Change-Id: Id2012dd69370f9cba01704a8ba2e8188d4ef107b
Related-Bug: #1788051

subject: Add MooseFS/MooseFS Pro Volume Driver Add a volume driver which can use MooseFS. MooseFS is an Open-source, POSIX-compliant distributed file system. MooseFS aims to be fault-tolerant, highly available, highly performing, scalable general-purpose network distributed file system for data centers. Driver has very similiar workflow to NFS, SMBFS or Virtuozzo.

commit_message:
Add MooseFS/MooseFS Pro Volume Driver
Add a volume driver which can use MooseFS.
MooseFS is an Open-source, POSIX-compliant distributed file system.
MooseFS aims to be fault-tolerant, highly available, highly
performing, scalable general-purpose network distributed file system
for data centers.
Driver has very similiar workflow to NFS, SMBFS or Virtuozzo.

Change-Id: Ifa2dca492793a796ee18ab995ec161113723f1b3
Depens-On: https://review.openstack.org/572460
Partially-Implements: driver-for-moosefs

messages:
[{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-02-09 17:59:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-02-09 17:59:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-02-09 18:03:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

sounds great :)'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-02-12 09:01:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Nice! Would you like to try the other direction? ie. creating the object only in OVN and not in Neutron?'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-02-12 11:18:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Nice! Would you like to try the other direction? ie. creating the
 > object only in OVN and not in Neutron?

Hi @Daniel, the problem with the other way around is that, for the revision numbers approach, the source of truth is the Neutron standardattributes database table. If we create an object in OVNDB and not in Neutron DB the maintenance thread won't detect it (it uses a JOIN between the standardattributes table and the ovn_revision_numbers table, both in Neutron DB).

So we would need to improve this detection if we decide that the Neutron API is not the only entrypoint for changes in OVNDB."}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-02-12 11:43:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

> > Nice! Would you like to try the other direction? ie. creating the
 > > object only in OVN and not in Neutron?
 > 
 > Hi @Daniel, the problem with the other way around is that, for the
 > revision numbers approach, the source of truth is the Neutron
 > standardattributes database table. If we create an object in OVNDB
 > and not in Neutron DB the maintenance thread won't detect it (it
 > uses a JOIN between the standardattributes table and the
 > ovn_revision_numbers table, both in Neutron DB).
 > 
 > So we would need to improve this detection if we decide that the
 > Neutron API is not the only entrypoint for changes in OVNDB.

Right, current sync script would handle those. We can keep it AS IS and try to maintain such script just in case."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-03-15 12:12:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-03-15 12:24:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-03-15 16:50:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-03-15 16:58:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-03-16 15:34:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2018-03-27 09:05:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Maintenance: Add functional tests for database sync task

This patch is adding functional tests for the task responsible for
fixing the database. Currently the resources covered are: Networks,
ports, routers, subnets, security groups and security group rules (apart
from delete, bug listed inline).

Note that router ports and floating IPs are still missing and will be
submitted on subsequently patches.

Change-Id: If523d68b53229934f19c99f9bcca5128d78e482b

commit_message:
Public n/w access for vxlan tenant n/w in ml2.ovs

Currently neutron role doesn't configure l3 agent (controller) for
external network connecitivity for the openstack tenant network.
This needs some manual configuration to provide public network
access for the tenant VMs. This review attempts to automate these
steps.

Change-Id: I653ee5136ac508c473cbdb761a00454a774a4336
Signed-off-by: Periyasamy Palanisamy <periyasamy.palanisamy@ericsson.com>

Thanks Daniel!

I think we can squash this patch with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570186/

They seem to complement each other'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-06-28 14:22:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I've been doing some tests about the migration with a local VM with only 4GB RAM running devstack and 1VCPU:

Creating 10 ports on 50 (actually 51) networks and all the ports with 5 security group rules (allow ssh, allow icmp, allow egress, allow ingress IPv4 from same SG and allow ingress IPv6 from same SG). Then ran the migration code to Port Groups.

for i in {1..50}; do
    openstack network create test_net$i
    openstack subnet create --network test_net$i --subnet-range 192.168.0.1/12 test_sub$i
    for j in {1..10}; do
        openstack port create --network test_net$i test_port$j
    done
done

Before:
$ openstack port list |grep test_port | wc -l
448
$ openstack network list |grep test_net | wc -l
51
$ openstack security group rule list -c ID -f value | wc -l
5
$ ovn-nbctl list ACL |grep uuid|wc -l
3600
$ ovn-nbctl list Address_Set | grep uuid | wc -l
8
$ ovn-sbctl list Logical_Flow | grep uuid | wc -l
16365


——
After:
$ ovn-nbctl list port_group | grep name | wc -l
57
$ ovn-nbctl list ACL |grep uuid|wc -l
71
vagrant@devstack:/opt/stack/networking-ovn(portgroups)
$ ovn-sbctl list Logical_Flow | grep uuid | wc -l
9917


[1] Delete address sets finished (took 0.12 seconds) {{(pid=26064) migrate_to_port_groups /opt/stack/networking-ovn/networking_ovn/ovn_db_sync.py:1055}}
[2] Delete ACLs from switches finished (took 1.91 seconds) {{(pid=26064) migrate_to_port_groups /opt/stack/networking-ovn/networking_ovn/ovn_db_sync.py:1060}}
[3] Create default Drop Port Group finished (took 3.62 seconds) {{(pid=26064) migrate_to_port_groups /opt/stack/networking-ovn/networking_ovn/ovn_db_sync.py:1065}}
[4] Create subnet Port Groups finished (took 22.39 seconds) {{(pid=26064) migrate_to_port_groups /opt/stack/networking-ovn/networking_ovn/ovn_db_sync.py:1070}}
[5] Create SG Port Groups and ACLs finished (took 1.83 seconds) {{(pid=26064) migrate_to_port_groups /opt/stack/networking-ovn/networking_ovn/ovn_db_sync.py:1075}}


There's still room for optimization here as I splitted every task and I'm repeating the queries and processing. Will work on it even though it's more coupled."}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-06-28 15:33:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-06-28 15:55:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-06-28 15:56:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-06-28 16:24:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

[1] Delete address sets finished (took 0.13 seconds)
[2] Delete ACLs from switches finished (took 1.86 seconds)
[3] Create default Drop Port Group finished (took 3.10 seconds)
[4] Create subnet Port Groups finished (took 1.82 seconds)
[5] Create SG Port Groups and ACLs finished (took 1.37 seconds)

The extraction of the db_ports from Neutron takes some time (around 1.8s for 500 ports) and I'm doing it a few times. It could be optimized."}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-06-28 16:32:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-06-28 16:41:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-06-28 16:42:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

TODO: distributed lock to do the migration only once across the cloud'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-06-28 16:42:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-06-28 16:50:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-07-02 08:57:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-07-02 09:50:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-07-02 14:07:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-07-05 09:54:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-07-05 13:14:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-07-06 09:36:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Some figures:

Time to create 1000 ports in OVN (just the create_port in mech driver):

No Port Groups:
Total: 351.940000
Average: 0.348236
Items: 1000

Port Groups:
Total: 154.990000
Average: 0.154990
Items: 1000

On average, creating a port in OVN would be 113% faster now.

This is the test script:

NETWORKS=50
PORTS_PER_NETWORK=20
SEC_GROUPS=20

for i in $(seq 0 $(($SEC_GROUPS - 1))); do
    openstack security group create sg$i
    openstack security group rule create --remote-group sg$i --ingress --ethertype IPv4 sg$i
    openstack security group rule create --remote-group sg$i --ingress --ethertype IPv6 sg$i
    openstack security group rule create --protocol tcp --dst 22 sg$i
    openstack security group rule create --protocol icmp sg$i
done

k=0
for i in $(seq 1 $NETWORKS); do
    openstack network create net$i
    openstack subnet create --network net$i --subnet-range 192.168.1.0/24 subnet$i
    for j in $(seq 1 $PORTS_PER_NETWORK); do
        openstack port create --network net$i port${i}_${j} --security-group sg$k
        k=$(( ($k + 1) % $SEC_GROUPS ))
    done
done'}, {'account_id': 11762, 'date': '2018-07-24 15:24:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Great job! Thanks Daniel. I believe if there are more rules in SG, the improvement will be even more obvious :)'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-08-03 15:47:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-08-07 09:44:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-08-07 12:49:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

'}, {'created': '2018-06-28 16:32:20.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Support Port Groups in networking-ovn

A new feature has been introduced in core OVN which allows to define
a group of ports and assign ACLs to those. This patch is making use
of the new feature if supported by the underlying OVS version.

As a result we'll be modelling Neutron Security Groups as OVN Port
Groups and we won't be adding one ACL per Security Group Rule per
port. Instead, just add one single ACL per Security Group. This will
also tackle the race conditions that we had for Address Sets as those
will just be used for Remote Security Groups and will be automatically
generated/deleted by core OVN in SB database upon Port Group creation/
deletion.

The major benefit of this patch is that we'll reduce the number of
ACL's dramatically, resulting in a performance leap as discussed at:
https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-discuss/2018-February/046166.html

This patch will address the migration of old Security Groups being
modelled as Address Sets if the OVN schema supports the feature.

Change-Id: I35d5ec40c666e92b92b9d664e9615c6fecde595a
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-06-28 16:41:47.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Support Port Groups in networking-ovn

A new feature has been introduced in core OVN which allows to define
a group of ports and assign ACLs to those. This patch is making use
of the new feature if supported by the underlying OVS version.

As a result we'll be modelling Neutron Security Groups as OVN Port
Groups and we won't be adding one ACL per Security Group Rule per
port. Instead, just add one single ACL per Security Group. This will
also tackle the race conditions that we had for Address Sets as those
will just be used for Remote Security Groups and will be automatically
generated/deleted by core OVN in SB database upon Port Group creation/
deletion.

The major benefit of this patch is that we'll reduce the number of
ACL's dramatically, resulting in a performance leap as discussed at:
https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-discuss/2018-February/046166.html

This patch will address the migration of old Security Groups being
modelled as Address Sets if the OVN schema supports the feature. This
migration will be performed from the OvnWorker which is holding a lock
on the IDL. This ensures that the migration happens from only one worker
in the cloud and after it's done, all the neutron-server instances are
ready to use Port Groups.

Change-Id: I35d5ec40c666e92b92b9d664e9615c6fecde595a
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-07-05 09:54:21.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Support Port Groups in networking-ovn

The major benefit of this patch is that we'll reduce the number of
ACL's dramatically, resulting in a performance leap as discussed at:
https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-discuss/2018-February/046166.html

This patch will address the migration of old Security Groups being
modelled as Address Sets if the OVN schema supports the feature. This
migration will be performed from the OvnWorker which is holding a lock
on the IDL. This ensures that the migration happens from only one worker
in the cloud and after it's done, all the neutron-server instances are
ready to use Port Groups.

Change-Id: I35d5ec40c666e92b92b9d664e9615c6fecde595a
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Support Port Groups in networking-ovn

A new feature has been introduced in core OVN which allows to define
a group of ports and assign ACLs to those. This patch is making use
of the new feature if supported by the underlying OVS version.

As a result we'll be modelling Neutron Security Groups as OVN Port
Groups and we won't be adding one ACL per Security Group Rule per
port. Instead, just add one single ACL per Security Group. This will
also tackle the race conditions that we had for Address Sets as those
will just be used for Remote Security Groups and will be automatically
generated/deleted by core OVN in SB database upon Port Group creation/
deletion.

The major benefit of this patch is that we'll reduce the number of
ACL's dramatically, resulting in a performance leap as discussed at:
https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-discuss/2018-February/046166.html

This patch will address the migration of old Security Groups being
modelled as Address Sets if the OVN schema supports the feature. This
migration will be performed from the OvnWorker which is holding a lock
on the IDL. This ensures that the migration happens from only one worker
in the cloud and after it's done, all the neutron-server instances are
ready to use Port Groups.

Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I35d5ec40c666e92b92b9d664e9615c6fecde595a
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix the ipmitool missing for ceilometer-ipmi image

To enable IPMI meters, ensure IPMITool is installed[0] and
the host supports Intel Node Manager.

[0]: https://docs.openstack.org/ceilometer/latest/install/install-compute-rdo.html
Co-Authored-By: caoyuan <cao.yuan@99cloud.net>

Change-Id: I45b66277c31a4d0e33e0c14e01313aa688287ec7
Closes-Bug: #1767750

subject: Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()
messages:
[{'account_id': 24, 'date': '2018-08-20 15:58:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-08-21 08:43:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

1) Neither Rally project, nor Rally-OpenStack has oslo_utils as direct dependency and no methods/modules are used from it. Actually, as for the Rally project, `oslo.utils` comes from `oslo.log` (see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580397/) and oslo.db

2) `oslo_utils.uuidutils.generate_uuid` doesn't do anything special. We do not need this dashes feature, so I do not see any reason for replacing the simple one-line code with a call to the external library which makes the code-readability worseю"}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2018-08-21 11:33:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

messages:

commit_message:
Add zvm CI information

z/VM is added in Rocky releaes and this patch added the CI
information and its coverage for z/VM.

blueprint: add-zvm-driver-rocky

Change-Id: Ibf44bc81ab0281c95dd4add9e09df584d61bc460

commit_message:
Fix typo in network_data files

The comments use ipv6_gateway, while the actual data
and code uses gateway_ipv6. This changes the comments
to use gateway_ipv6 as well.

Change-Id: I3b173fca479e778f75307b7bb47bd7954ea786f4

commit_message:
SSL support for haproxy -> novnc proxy connection

With tls-everywhere enabled the connection from haproxy to the nova novnc
proxy was not encrypted. Now we request a certificate and configue haproxy
and the novnc proxy to encrypt this remaining part in a vnc connection to
be encrypted as well.

Change-Id: Ia0c8c452f0121298bef58409bd0bdbe4caa54e42
Closes-Bug: #1785700
Depends-On: Ice51fe175bdc1cb14fa49cf53d1f38e9728bbb60
Depends-On: I4667706633205c240f2efb51663e6efbce5e344e

commit_message:
SSL support for haproxy -> novnc proxy connection

With tls-everywhere enabled the connection from haproxy to the nova novnc
proxy was not encrypted. Now we request a certificate and configue haproxy
and the novnc proxy to encrypt this remaining part in a vnc connection to
be encrypted as well.

Change-Id: I4667706633205c240f2efb51663e6efbce5e344e
Related-bug: #1785700
Depends-On: Ice51fe175bdc1cb14fa49cf53d1f38e9728bbb60

commit_message:
Update infra-manual publishing

use tox-docs jobs for building and publishing.

Also, remove some extra templates for jobs that use the read-the-docs
template - the template includes check and gate build-sphinx job, so
build-sphinx and noop-jobs can be removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/593723
Change-Id: Ib9f5f1db8853d0f4ef18d5d67d0258c5f40797e1

Move static _get_power_off_values to compute_utils

Move this static method to be with similar methods in compute.utils.
Also remove unused context argument, which adds a little noise.

commit_message:
Redis: Mount certificates on TLS proxy

We were mounting the TLS certificates on the redis container and not on
the proxy itself.

Change-Id: I52c53103362371ea1a82130e1ee48fef2d194bed
Closes-Bug: #1787959
(cherry picked from commit c41c427ad6bf6ce787dd40ba99919a26a6560349)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-20 20:34:29.000000000', 'message': 'Address python3 string issues with subprocess

This patch updates our Popen calls to enable universal newlines for
calls that we parse or consume the output for. Without
univeral_newlines=True, the output is treated as bytes under python3
which leads to issues later where we are using it as strings.

See https://docs.python.org/3/glossary.html#term-universal-newlines

Change-Id: Id0060a3abbcda8edb6124eb096cb824aaea48396

commit_message:
Address python3 string issues with subprocess

This patch updates our Popen calls to enable universal newlines for
calls that we parse or consume the output for. Without
univeral_newlines=True, the output is treated as bytes under python3
which leads to issues later where we are using it as strings.

See https://docs.python.org/3/glossary.html#term-universal-newlines

Change-Id: Id0060a3abbcda8edb6124eb096cb824aaea48396

commit_message:
remove job settings for vitrage repositories

This is a mechanically generated patch to remove the job settings that
have been migrated to the git repositories owned by the vitrage team.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I895ef5a1a10570fcddecab073b3848f281c12817
Story: #2002586
Task: #24343

commit_message:
Reject zero volume size in API

According the discussion[1], set volume size to 0 makes no sense.
This fix reject zero value of volume size with integer or string type.
The previous commit[2] has reject negative volume size, with this fix,
value like 0, '0' will be rejected and value like 001, '040' will pass.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/589034/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/164460/
Signed-off-by: zhanggang <zhanggang@cmss.chinamobile.com>

Change-Id: If18a3c69a2815086cc60f9a6a24e6254cc7856df

commit_message:
use include_tasks instead of include

include is marked as deprecated since ansible 2.4[0]

Switch to include_tasks or import_playbook as necessary

[0] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.4/include_module.html#deprecated

Change-Id: Ieff641e85a61b596f8a3a96820e1842d91f8f05c

  * Remove `-p -u root` from mysql to make it more consistent with
    other install docs like nova or keystone.

TrivialFix

commit_message:
Use the TESTING_BRANCH env var for constraints

The TESTING_BRANCH environment variable is provided by the
run_tests.sh script and is derived from the .gitreview file.

This ensures that once the master branch becomes a stable
branch, the constraints from the stable branch in the
integrated repository will automatically get used once the
.gitreview file is updated.

To ensure that the required environment variables are present
we export them appropriately in run_tests.sh and modify the
tox configuration to pass them into the tox test.

Change-Id: I19fc2e4ee2b16dd3c9343af9caf8ddd452f11125
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/579371

commit_message:
Use the TESTING_BRANCH env var for constraints

The TESTING_BRANCH environment variable is provided by the
run_tests.sh script and is derived from the .gitreview file.

This ensures that once the master branch becomes a stable
branch, the constraints from the stable branch in the
integrated repository will automatically get used once the
.gitreview file is updated.

To ensure that the required environment variables are present
we export them appropriately in run_tests.sh and modify the
tox configuration to pass them into the tox test.

Change-Id: I01e4df147134b3fa2eca8e9cae977db6444c9a48
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/579371

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Id7511a2c91bfbf2fd8cf4643693263889a72c255

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-19 15:51:28.000000000', 'message': "Cleanup unused pip packages

The virtualenv shouldn't be installed individually by a role,
therefore should be removed. The other packages are not really
necessary since they are remnant from the role creation (copied
and pasted from another role).

Thus we also remove the task related to the install of those.

Change-Id: I76b870ae54602a0c7f99774b250c447c748fb6aa
(cherry picked from commit a05457498ff2ab6a8a6105b215826678c40c3afe)
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup unused pip packages

The virtualenv shouldn't be installed individually by a role,
therefore should be removed. The other packages are not really
necessary since they are remnant from the role creation (copied
and pasted from another role).

Thus we also remove the task related to the install of those.

Change-Id: I76b870ae54602a0c7f99774b250c447c748fb6aa
(cherry picked from commit a05457498ff2ab6a8a6105b215826678c40c3afe)

 elsewhere in the file depending on the exact syntax problem.\n\nThe offending line appears to be:\n\n\n- name: Create openrc file\n  ^ here\n"
}

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-20 16:03:04.000000000', 'message': 'Gather facts for openstack_openrc role

The openstack_openrc role need to make use of variables
only available if facts are gathered.

In this patch we ensure that facts are gathered for both
times the role is executed.

Change-Id: I327e7e127d4f9022d3fe0643122df37828e9f17d
'}]
commit_message:
Gather facts for openstack_openrc role

The openstack_openrc role need to make use of variables
only available if facts are gathered.

In this patch we ensure that facts are gathered for both
times the role is executed.

Change-Id: I327e7e127d4f9022d3fe0643122df37828e9f17d

commit_message:
Blacklist setuptools 39.2.0

Can not install psutil===5.4.5 when setuptools==39.2.0.
If use setuptools==39.2.0, it will raise error:
"ImportError: 'module' object has no attribute
'check_specifier'"
The reference [1] also discuss this problem.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/4104

Closes-Bug: #1776174
Change-Id: If6bdd292cd1619d338dd9e6cb8e6c491942fe5d0

[{'created': '2018-08-06 18:32:37.000000000', 'message': "Clean up tests a bit

1. Remove tests/test-configure-octavia.yml because the 'shade' package
   does not need to be installed again - this is already done by the
   role test preparation.

2. Remove the key generation as the keys are already generated in the
   common tests playbook 'test-prepare-keys.yml'.

3. Add some spacing between tasks to make it more readable.

4. Implement the extra packages needed in test-requirements.txt instead
   of trying to use a task to install them, because doing it in Ansible
   makes understanding the venv in relation to the inventory complicated..

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/589248
Change-Id: I46962090f7baf4227e838e125fd318245f2bcb85
"}, {'created': '2018-08-06 18:37:03.000000000', 'message': "Clean up tests a bit

   does not need to be installed again - this is already done by the
   role test preparation.

2. Remove the key generation as the keys are already generated in the
   common tests playbook 'test-prepare-keys.yml'.

3. Add some spacing between tasks to make it more readable.

4. Implement the extra packages needed in test-requirements.txt instead
   of trying to use a task to install them, because doing it in Ansible
   makes understanding the venv in relation to the inventory complicated..

5. Move the vars_files argument to the top of the play to make it easier
   to find and more uniform with other plays in OSA.

6. Switch from using octavia_ansible_endpoint_type to a hard-coded
   endpoint, then remove the octavia_ansible_endpoint_type var.

commit_message:
Clean up tests a bit

1. Remove tests/test-configure-octavia.yml because the 'shade' package
   does not need to be installed again - this is already done by the
   role test preparation.

2. Remove the key generation as the keys are already generated in the
   common tests playbook 'test-prepare-keys.yml'.

3. Add some spacing between tasks to make it more readable.

4. Implement the extra packages needed in test-requirements.txt instead
   of trying to use a task to install them, because doing it in Ansible
   makes understanding the venv in relation to the inventory complicated..

5. Move the vars_files argument to the top of the play to make it easier
   to find and more uniform with other plays in OSA.

6. Switch from using octavia_ansible_endpoint_type to a hard-coded
   endpoint, then remove the octavia_ansible_endpoint_type var.

7. Switch from using the 'endpoint_type' argument for the openstack
   modules to using the more modern 'interface' argument.

8. Remove the 'run_once' argument on the 'Upload key to nova' task
   because only localhost is targeted, so the argument is moot.

9. Remove the 'Set VIP fact' task in favor of just using the 'vip_output'
   register in the 'Test the Listener' task. Setting a fact is pointless.

10. To help the existing patches pass, we add python-pip to the distro
    packages. This will be reverted later once the required changes
    to remove this requirement have merged.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/589248
Change-Id: I46962090f7baf4227e838e125fd318245f2bcb85

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I55544b1bda00b2f571fcd2b3bb5dde1554726522

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the

[{'created': '2018-08-20 13:27:08.000000000', 'message': 'Pick proper mirror for ceph apt::pin

When running in CI the ceph packages are mirrored
and the official download.ceph.com is not used.

This changes so we apt::pin the proper mirror that
the ceph packages come from, otherwise the ubuntu
cloud-archive ceph packages will be installed instead
of the official ceph ones.

cloud-archive ceph packages will be installed instead
of the official ceph ones.

Change-Id: Ica5e74bc67663541f8564a8920db5567f6c85197

commit_message:
Pick proper mirror for ceph apt::pin

When running in CI the ceph packages are mirrored
and the official download.ceph.com is not used.

This changes so we apt::pin the proper mirror that
the ceph packages come from, otherwise the ubuntu
cloud-archive ceph packages will be installed instead
of the official ceph ones.

Change-Id: Ica5e74bc67663541f8564a8920db5567f6c85197

commit_message:
add python 3.6 unit test job

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.6 as part of the python3-first goal.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

commit_message:
Ceph backup: set close_fds on Popen

Open file descriptors should not be passed
to the child processes.

This only affects Python 2, Python 3.2+ defaults
to this value being True.

Change-Id: I5c9bb0c04a4aafae8815667f56be4dee07c4aab7

commit_message:
Remove support for manila::backend::cephfsnative class

This class was replaced by manila::backend::cephfs
in openstack/puppet-manila in the Pike release.

See corresponding change in openstack/puppet-manila [1]

[1] Ib13dfc6ffa77e96f5738c2ca3f9646a80aded659

Change-Id: I6757cd2368021b55775ad54931aa0b78c8383a68

commit_message:
Hard-Coded Mount point location to Dynamic location

The current Tempest chart has mount points hardcoded
in the file tempest/templates/job-run-tests.yaml which
makes providing over-rides for those values difficult.

To ensure that the same can be over-ridden in a custom
Tempest chart deployment; the hardcoded values have been
templatized and moved over to values.yaml to provide better
flexibility in a custom chart deployment.

Change-Id: I7b8c9ce2bb6498e89c306b5274e3d1e3d3c08518

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-09 05:22:26.000000000', 'message': "Add pydot to global-requirements.txt

Recently pydot3 was introduced which was a fork of pydot introducing
Python 3.x compatibility. Since then pydot has added python 3.x support
and seems to be more regularly releasing than pydot3, which hasn't
seen a single release since two years. Furthermore networkx is actually
requiring pydot and will refuse to run with pydot3 installed so there
isn't much choice.

Is the library actively maintained?

Last release Dec 25, 2017 and no indications of project being abandoned.

Is the library good code?

Merging the pydot3 changes it should be as good as the pydot3 addition.

Is the library license compatible?

Yes.

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?

Yes.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?

It was covered by pydot3 which this one is superseding.

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?

Taskflow needs pydot for executing its networkx graph generation unit
test.

If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process does it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?

No.

Change-Id: Ie0607c86259bda5483b2bf4f6f9a87f93cd9be0e
"}]
commit_message:
Add pydot to global-requirements.txt

Recently pydot3 was introduced which was a fork of pydot introducing
Python 3.x compatibility. Since then pydot has added python 3.x support
and seems to be more regularly releasing than pydot3, which hasn't
seen a single release since two years. Furthermore networkx is actually
requiring pydot and will refuse to run with pydot3 installed so there
isn't much choice.

Is the library actively maintained?

Last release Dec 25, 2017 and no indications of project being abandoned.

Is the library good code?

Merging the pydot3 changes it should be as good as the pydot3 addition.

Is the library license compatible?

Yes.

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?

Yes.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?

It was covered by pydot3 which this one is superseding.

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?

Taskflow needs pydot for executing its networkx graph generation unit
test.

If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process does it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?

No.

Change-Id: Ie0607c86259bda5483b2bf4f6f9a87f93cd9be0e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-08 13:40:24.000000000', 'message': "Remove pydot3

This released last time in 2016, which doesn't look healthy.
There is pydot instead which is actually a dependency of
networkx 2.1 (which is used by taskflow), hence we want to
switch to a more maintained version.

Change-Id: I1e10eb7d3389e3d61a7e54c0be3edb0e381c3175
"}]
commit_message:
Remove pydot3

This released last time in 2016, which doesn't look healthy.
There is pydot instead which is actually a dependency of
networkx 2.1 (which is used by taskflow), hence we want to
switch to a more maintained version.

Change-Id: I1e10eb7d3389e3d61a7e54c0be3edb0e381c3175

commit_message:
Drop nose dependencies

Horizon test setting no longer depends on nose and related stuffs.
This commit cleans up nose related dependencies.

The change was made in horizon Rocky-3,
so horizon 14.0.0.0b3 is required at least.

Change-Id: I9e55d157dd1c11037cdd522cce9065d84830ff6d

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Iececc491758bcbc4dad5d48e579dfaf9fa14e3f1

[{'created': '2018-08-17 20:37:30.000000000', 'message': 'Only do yum update when needed

Currently the logic for this results in a full yum update when no
package updates are found in the provided repository. This can lead to
job timeouts when nothing was built in CI because it effectively does a
yum update on every container and applies other system packages rather
than ones that actually changed.

There is a larger issue in that we can still get out of sync with the
host OS.

Change-Id: Iaf41691ea3cb6e78186741ac5e15614fb73f89ff
Related-Bug: #1786764
'}]
commit_message:
Only do yum update when needed

Currently the logic for this results in a full yum update when no
package updates are found in the provided repository. This can lead to
job timeouts when nothing was built in CI because it effectively does a
yum update on every container and applies other system packages rather
than ones that actually changed.

There is a larger issue in that we can still get out of sync with the
host OS.

Change-Id: Iaf41691ea3cb6e78186741ac5e15614fb73f89ff
Related-Bug: #1786764

commit_message:
prune dead branches when syncing with origin

The release scripts rely on having an actually up to date version of
the repo being tagged or branched. Since the repos in the CI images
may have branches that have been deleted in the upstream repository,
we need to add the --prune option when we fetch any updates to cause
those branches to be removed locally.

Change-Id: I806283102be4de5ae865ca67978216a76de96a71
Related-commit: I25848275f90ec440e85765f87a23cd1413aab6cb
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-14 19:41:55.000000000', 'message': "Explicitly add stable-maint-core to governed repos

Some repos have ACLs with groups that contain the stable-maint-core
group, while others do not include the group at all. All governed repos
should include this team, even if they don't assert
stable:follows-policy so stable branch issues can be resolved as needed.

To make it consistent and clear, this adds stable-maint-core directly to
the ACLs for all repos under governance.

Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Explicitly add stable-maint-core to governed repos

Some repos have ACLs with groups that contain the stable-maint-core
group, while others do not include the group at all. All governed repos
should include this team, even if they don't assert
stable:follows-policy so stable branch issues can be resolved as needed.

To make it consistent and clear, this adds stable-maint-core directly to
the ACLs for all repos under governance.

Change-Id: Ifdc429e2c9609475584f0473828d41d3f1067c72
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Redis: Mount certificates on TLS proxy

We were mounting the TLS certificates on the redis container and not on
the proxy itself.

Change-Id: I52c53103362371ea1a82130e1ee48fef2d194bed
Closes-Bug: #1787959

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-04 00:13:46.000000000', 'message': "Fix default value for Gnocchi auth mode

The correct values or auth modes for Gnocchi are 'basic' and 'keystone'.
This patch fixes the 'simple' usage to 'basic'. Note that without this rename
the deployment works because when 'simple' is used the parameter is not used
in config file, so value 'basic' is used by python-collectd-gnocchi, because
it is implicit default.

Change-Id: I05632137ed12c59a41a5219189c431983935d461
(cherry picked from commit 1082bde8e8dbe0739510a47a1af8ab56babe51bd)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix default value for Gnocchi auth mode

The correct values or auth modes for Gnocchi are 'basic' and 'keystone'.
This patch fixes the 'simple' usage to 'basic'. Note that without this rename
the deployment works because when 'simple' is used the parameter is not used
in config file, so value 'basic' is used by python-collectd-gnocchi, because
it is implicit default.

Change-Id: I05632137ed12c59a41a5219189c431983935d461
(cherry picked from commit 1082bde8e8dbe0739510a47a1af8ab56babe51bd)

commit_message:
Fix Octavia for host host routes

If the subnet attached to an Octavia load balancer had a host route defined
that was actually a host, the load balancer would go into ERROR.
This patch fixes that issue by checking the host route and handling the
netns route additions properly.

Change-Id: I95e8ed377d4ed12aab4ecb2142896b13a9b21079
Story: 2003441
Task: 24637
(cherry picked from commit 1f73119b7c206f27aaf248adb9235bcd8e031c74)

commit_message:
support older git without -C option

Older versions of git do not support the -C option, so switch from
using that to using pushd/cd where appropriate.

Change-Id: Iee0a95f2a790206e9f2caaa47c60ec8273272eea
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
dev mode: Add support for designate

Provide support for kolla dev mode in designate. When
'kolla_dev_mode' or 'designate_dev_mode' variables are
enabled, source code of designate project is cloned
and bindmounted.

Partially implements: blueprint mount-sources
Co-Authored-By: zhulingjie <easyzlj@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ib23fbd3d5ebc7e3ac372e0db1e0048d333eb95c0

subject: Rework Cinder volume multi-attach
messages:
[{'account_id': 23829, 'date': '2018-08-10 07:35:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23829, 'date': '2018-08-10 07:39:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23829, 'date': '2018-08-10 08:00:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23829, 'date': '2018-08-13 06:14:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 23829, 'date': '2018-08-13 09:06:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 23829, 'date': '2018-08-14 01:12:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 21428, 'date': '2018-08-14 01:40:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Why do we need to make changes? Could you elaborate on it？ Thx'}, {'account_id': 23829, 'date': '2018-08-14 02:05:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> Why do we need to make changes? Could you elaborate on it？ Thx

If the volume attached to two containers, when detached the volume from the first container, the current progress just destroy the volume_mapping in Zun. But the attachment of the first container in Cinder is residual. In any case, the "detach" of cinder should be called.'}, {'account_id': 23829, 'date': '2018-08-16 01:21:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 23829, 'date': '2018-08-16 02:46:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 23829, 'date': '2018-08-16 03:05:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23829, 'date': '2018-08-16 03:17:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-08-16 03:28:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23829, 'date': '2018-08-18 04:14:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-08-18 17:31:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-08-18 17:47:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

FYI,

I asked on the #openstack-cinder channel about multiattach on the same host. Here is the log: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-cinder/%23openstack-cinder.2018-08-17.log.html#t2018-08-17T18:07:46 .

My takeaway is:

* If we are using cinder to track attachment of each container, we need to go through the cinder attach/detach workflow (reserve_volume -> initialize_connection -> attach/begin_detaching -> terminate_connection -> detach) for each attach/detach.
* The initiator needs to be handled differently. On attach, we can use initiator (os-brick) to connects to the volume multiple time, but on detach, we should use initiator to disconnect on the last detach.
* The recommendation of doing that is to use the new workflow (attachment-create, attachment-delete).'}, {'account_id': 21428, 'date': '2018-08-21 02:07:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 21486, 'date': '2018-08-21 02:22:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1'}]

If need further explains, please look up the bug's information.

"}, {'created': '2018-08-16 03:17:10.000000000', 'message': 'Rework Cinder volume multi-attach

The current progress does not handle the volume residual information in
Cinder.

   For example, a volume attached to two containers which is on same or
different nodes. When detach the volume from the first container,we can
use "cinder show" to see the volume information. The attachment_id and
the attached_servers still have the first container's information.
  And then, detach volume from the second container, use "cinder show" to
see the volume information. The volume's status is still "in-use" and
attachment information is still existing.

    The reason is that when the volume is attached to more than one
containers, the current progress just destroyed the volume_mapping
table in Zun sql, and did nothing to Cinder.

    The cinder_api.detach should be called in any case, because it can
clean up attachment information in Cinder sql.

Co-Authored-By:  YaoZheng <zheng.yao1@zte.com.cn>
Change-Id: I05e29721a0dbe9d976fb8bc762ec8751dbaaf172
Closes-Bug: #1787308
'}, {'created': '2018-08-18 04:14:20.000000000', 'message': 'Rework Cinder volume multi-attach

The current progress does not handle the volume residual information in
Cinder.

   For example, a volume attached to two containers which is on same or
different nodes. When detach the volume from the first container,we can
use "cinder show" to see the volume information. The attachment_id and
the attached_servers still have the first container's information.
  And then, detach volume from the second container, use "cinder show" to
see the volume information. The volume's status is still "in-use" and
attachment information is still existing.

    The reason is that when the volume is attached to more than one
containers, the current progress just destroyed the volume_mapping
table in Zun sql, and did nothing to Cinder.

    The cinder_api.detach should be called in any case, because it can
clean up attachment information in Cinder sql.

Co-Authored-By:  YaoZheng <zheng.yao1@zte.com.cn>
Change-Id: I05e29721a0dbe9d976fb8bc762ec8751dbaaf172
Closes-Bug: #1787308
'}]
commit_message:
Rework Cinder volume multi-attach

The current progress does not handle the volume residual information in
Cinder.

   For example, a volume attached to two containers which is on same or
different nodes. When detach the volume from the first container,we can
use "cinder show" to see the volume information. The attachment_id and
the attached_servers still have the first container's information.
  And then, detach volume from the second container, use "cinder show" to
see the volume information. The volume's status is still "in-use" and
attachment information is still existing.

    The reason is that when the volume is attached to more than one
containers, the current progress just destroyed the volume_mapping
table in Zun sql, and did nothing to Cinder.

    The cinder_api.detach should be called in any case, because it can
clean up attachment information in Cinder sql.

Co-Authored-By:  YaoZheng <zheng.yao1@zte.com.cn>
Change-Id: I05e29721a0dbe9d976fb8bc762ec8751dbaaf172
Closes-Bug: #1787308
